disease.label: Neurodevelopmental disorder with coarse facies and mild distal skeletal abnormalities

term.label: Neurodevelopmental disorder with coarse facies and mild distal skeletal abnormalities

resources.name: An Online Catalog of Human Genes and Genetic Disorders

externalReferences.description: The clinical and molecular spectrum of the KDM6B-related neurodevelopmental disorder

query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: Individual 73
Patient age: 10 years
Patient sex: Male
Patient features: Delayed speech and language development, Hip dysplasia, Intellectual disability, mild, Protruding ear, Single transverse palmar crease, Motor delay, Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, Microcephaly, Autistic behavior, Short chin, Mild hypermetropia, Hypertelorism, Hypotonia, Joint hypermobility.
Excluded patient features: Pectus excavatum, Cleft palate, Hearing impairment.

messages.name: search

function.name: run_query
function.arguments:
{"query":"MATCH (d:biolink_Disease)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p:biolink_PhenotypicFeature) WHERE p.id IN ['HP:0000750','HP:0001385','HP:0001256','HP:0000411','HP:0000954','HP:0001270','HP:0007018','HP:0000252','HP:0000729','HP:0000331','HP:0031728','HP:0000316','HP:0001252','HP:0001382']
WITH d, count(p) AS matched_features
ORDER BY matched_features DESC
LIMIT 30
OPTIONAL MATCH (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(ep:biolink_PhenotypicFeature)
WHERE ep.id IN ['HP:0000767','HP:0000175','HP:0000365']
WITH d, matched_features, collect(ep.id) AS excluded_features
WHERE size(excluded_features) = 0
RETURN d, matched_features
ORDER BY matched_features DESC
LIMIT 10"}

messages.content: {'result_as_graph': {'type': 'graph', 'data': {'nodes': [{'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0859190', 'caption': 'neurodevelopmental-craniofacial syndrome with variable renal and cardiac abnormalities', 'name': 'neurodevelopmental-craniofacial syndrome with variable renal and cardiac abnormalities', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010496', 'caption': 'X-linked intellectual disability-short stature-overweight syndrome', 'name': 'X-linked intellectual disability-short stature-overweight syndrome', 'description': 'X-linked intellectual disability-short stature-overweight syndrome is a multiple congenital anomalies syndrome characterized by borderline to severe intellectual disability, speech delay, short stature, elevated body mass index, a pattern of truncal obesity (reported in older males), and variable neurologic features (e.g. hypotonia, tremors, gait disturbances, behavioral problems, and seizure disorders). Less common manifestations include microcephaly, microorchidism and/or microphallus. Dysmorphic features have been reported in some patients but no consistent pattern has been noted.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013364', 'caption': 'Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to EP300 haploinsufficiency', 'name': 'Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to EP300 haploinsufficiency', 'description': 'Any Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the EP300 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0030934', 'caption': 'intellectual developmental disorder, autosomal dominant 64', 'name': 'intellectual developmental disorder, autosomal dominant 64', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0957228', 'caption': 'intellectual developmental disorder, autosomal dominant 71, with behavioral abnormalities', 'name': 'intellectual developmental disorder, autosomal dominant 71, with behavioral abnormalities', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013352', 'caption': 'intellectual disability-severe speech delay-mild dysmorphism syndrome', 'name': 'intellectual disability-severe speech delay-mild dysmorphism syndrome', 'description': 'Intellectual disability-severe speech delay-mild dysmorphism syndrome, also known as intellectual disability with language impairment and with or without autistic features, is adisorder characterized by global developmental delay with moderate to severe speech delay thataffects expressive speech. Most patients have difficulty articulating words. Common signs and symptoms include broad forehead, downslanting palpebral fissures, short nose with broad tip, head appearing too large for the body, frontal hair upsweep, and bulging digit pads anddelatyed gross motor skills. Some patients have autistic features and/or behavioral problems. Congenital malformations may be associated. All reported cases have occurred de novo (without any cases in the family). It is caused by alterations (mutations) in the caused by heterozygous mutation in the FOXP1 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0030606', 'caption': 'Bryant-Li-Bhoj neurodevelopmental syndrome 1', 'name': 'Bryant-Li-Bhoj neurodevelopmental syndrome 1', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0032697', 'caption': 'Houge-Janssens syndrome 3', 'name': 'Houge-Janssens syndrome 3', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}
messages.name: run_query

messages.content:
Based on the patient's features and the exclusion of certain findings, here is a rank-ordered list of the most likely diagnoses from the Monarch knowledge graph. These are selected for the best match to the provided phenotypes and the absence of excluded features (pectus excavatum, cleft palate, hearing impairment):

1. [Neurodevelopmental-craniofacial syndrome with variable renal and cardiac abnormalities](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0859190)
2. [X-linked intellectual disability-short stature-overweight syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0010496)  
   - Features: Intellectual disability, speech delay, microcephaly, hypotonia, behavioral problems, and some dysmorphic features.
3. [Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to EP300 haploinsufficiency](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0013364)
4. [Intellectual developmental disorder, autosomal dominant 64](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0030934)
5. [Intellectual developmental disorder, autosomal dominant 71, with behavioral abnormalities](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0957228)
6. [Intellectual disability-severe speech delay-mild dysmorphism syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0013352)  
   - Features: Global developmental delay, severe speech delay, mild dysmorphism, some autistic features, and behavioral problems.
7. [Bryant-Li-Bhoj neurodevelopmental syndrome 1](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0030606)
8. [Houge-Janssens syndrome 3](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0032697)

These syndromes are associated with combinations of intellectual disability, speech and motor delay, autistic behavior, microcephaly, hypotonia, joint hypermobility, and craniofacial features, and do not typically include the excluded features.

If you would like more details about any of these conditions or wish to see additional possible diagnoses, please let me know!

expected_diagnosis_mondo.disease_name: neurodevelopmental disorder with coarse facies and mild distal skeletal abnormalities
